info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 06 at 2:34AM PDT until May 07 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT SATURDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon and Southern Oregon Cascades, including Crater Lake National Park, Diamond Lake, and the Cascade passes along highways 138, 230, 58, and 62. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan for difficult travel conditions. Roads may be slick and snow covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Brief snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour with visibility less than one half of a mile are possible during periods of heavier snowfall. Road conditions could change quickly going from wet at times to snow covered. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
